Characteristics: Single instead of multiple drug product delivered to the patient, increasing compliance while reducing medical error
Pre-condition: Proven synergistic medical benefit and safety from combinational clinical trials
Risk: Possible reduction in dosage flexibility            Number of patients that can accept combination therapy could show population and disease variance

Pre-condition: Integration in process development            Stability of each DC does not change significantly in the mixture            Analytics to characterise the degradation of individual drug component in the mixture
Risk: More complex control strategy            Availability of analytics            Change in delivery route if co-formulated products have lower concentration tolerance (             e.g.            from SC to IV)            Additional clinical trials are needed to prove the safety of co-formulated products

Pre-condition: Potential IP extension of existing drugs
Risk: New regulation landscape needs to be introduced (potential delay in BLA approval)
